title: Remove all Sonner toast popups while preserving existing app behavior

requirements.summary: Disable all automated in-app toast notifications by removing the global Sonner Toaster and replacing all toast calls with a no-op notifier, without altering underlying flows.
acceptanceCriteria: Creating a mission does not display a success toast (e.g., “Mission created successfully”).
Deleting a mission does not display a success toast (e.g., “Mission deleted successfully”).
No other toast popups appear for any app actions (success, info, or error toasts).
All existing CRUD and upload flows continue to function as before (no behavior changes besides the absence of toast popups).
The frontend builds cleanly without TypeScript errors (e.g., no unused imports after toast/Toaster removal).

file_operations.description: Remove Sonner Toaster wiring (import and rendered <Toaster />) so the app no longer mounts a toast container; ensure no unused imports remain. (Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui.)
Add a tiny no-op toast implementation that matches the Sonner API surface used in the app (e.g., success/error/info) so existing control flow can remain unchanged while producing no UI popups.

Replace `toast` import from 'sonner' with the shared no-op toast utility and keep all validations/returns and upload/link/note flows unchanged; ensure no toasts are emitted (including speech-to-text error handling).
Replace `toast` import from 'sonner' with the shared no-op toast utility and keep mission delete flows, optimistic updates, and guards unchanged while preventing all success/error toast popups.
Replace `toast` import from 'sonner' with the shared no-op toast utility; keep mission creation validation and mutation flow unchanged while removing all toast popups.
Remove dev-only dynamic import and usage of Sonner toast in the smoke-test runner (keep smoke test capability and console logging intact) so no toasts can appear even in development.
